subSubSection.paragraph:
Syntypi
—CAUCASUS, RUSSIA . Terek Province et Regio Tschernomorsch ( LE
01042940 , 01042938 , 01042941 , 01042942
, images!).
R. elbursensis Gauba & Rechinger
f., (1941: 99)
.

Typus —
IRAN . Mazandaran : In vally Chalus ,
2000 m
, Gauba 900 ( W 6355 !)
.
Description —Young branches and leave are pubescent with orbicular, ovate to elliptic and lanceolate leaves.

Habitat and distribution —
The variety is an Euro-Siberian element of Azerbaijan , Kurdistan Mazandaran and Golestan Provinces of N to W & C Iran . It growes at an altitude of
1400-2600 m
, between 45° and 53° E and between 35° and 38° N on slopes E & W and E-W aspect, mostly along the rivers in forests, on rocks of pasture lands and forests
.

Discussion —
R. cathartica subsp. caucasica
is very variable in habit and leaves. Leaves are mostly ovoid to elliptic, rarely orbicular or lanceolate, thin herbaceous, base mostly obtus e . They are tall trees or shrubs, erect in forests with a few simple spines, while in the Sad Sia Bishe and Dashte nazir populations, leaves are rhomboid, lanceolate, thick herbaceous to coriaceous, acute at base; the habit of a few specimens in Sad Sia Bisheh population is short ( 20–120 cm ), spreading on the rocks with lots of simple or branches spines.
